Postcode

  • Notes
  • HTML
  • Info

When to use this component

The select component should only be used as a last resort in public-facing services because research shows that some users find selects very difficult to use.

How it works

The select component allows users to choose an option from a long list. Before using the select component, try asking users questions which will allow you to present them with fewer options.

Asking questions means youâ€™re less likely to need to use the select component, and can consider using a different solution, such as radios.

<legend>Search your postcode</legend>
<div class="input-group">
    <input type="text" class="search-control" placeholder="Search">
    <div class="input-group-addon search-group">
        <button type="submit" style="background: none;border:0;">
          <span class="visuallyhidden">Search</span>
          <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-search"></span>
        </button>
    </div>
</div>

<legend>Chosen Dropdown</legend>
<div class="find">
    <h3>Find data in your area</h3>
    <p>Enter a UK area</p>
    <div id="dropdown3"></div>
</div>
<script>
    console.log('start of script')
    dropdownData = ["Cardiff", "Newport", "London"]
    d3.select("#dropdown3")
        .append("select")
        .attr("id", "droppy2")
        .attr("style", "width:100%")
        .attr("data-placeholder", "Choose a letter")
    d3.select("#droppy2")
        .append("option")
    d3.select("#droppy2")
        .selectAll("p")
        .data(dropdownData)
        .enter()
        .append("option")
        .attr("value", function(d) {
            return d
        })
        .text(function(d) {
            return d
        });
    $('#droppy2').chosen({
        allow_single_deselect: true,
        no_results_text: "No results found for:"
    })
</script>
